task.title: Caching Images on the Cluster Controller

context.p: To reduce calls to Walrus, Eucalyptus provides a means for images, including ramdisk and kernel images, to be cached on a cluster controller (CC). If this feature is enabled, when Eucalyptus starts an instance, it will first look for the instance image in the CC image cache location. If the image is not found in the CC image cache, it will be loaded from Walrus, and stored in the cache if space is available.

substep.cmd: Uncomment the CC_IMAGE_PROXY line and specify the IP of the CC host on which to cache images.

info.codeblock: # Set this to make the CC cache images, kernels and ramdisks. NCs must # be able to reach the CC with the specified value. CC_IMAGE_PROXY="192.168.0.100"

substep.cmd: Set CC_IMAGE_PROXY_PATH to point to the location of the image cache.

info.codeblock: # Set this to the location where the CC image proxy should store cached # images. The default is /var/lib/eucalyptus/dynserv/ CC_IMAGE_PROXY_PATH="/disk1/storage/cc_cache"

substep.cmd: Set CC_IMAGE_PROXY_CACHE_SIZE to the maximum size of the image cache.

info.codeblock: # Set this to the maximum size (in megabytes) of the CC image proxy cache. # The default is 32768, or 32 gigabytes. CC_IMAGE_PROXY_CACHE_SIZE="32768"
info.note: Setting CC_IMAGE_PROXY_CACHE_SIZE to 0 will cause any attempts to create an instance from an uncached image to remain pending indefinitely. To disable image caching, comment out the CC_IMAGE_PROXY line.

step.cmd: Create a data directory at the location specified in CC_IMAGE_PROXY_PATH, and give the “eucalyptus” user full access to the directory.
Perform a clean restart of the cluster controller.

info.note: A clean restart should only be performed when no instances are running, or when instance service interruption can be tolerated. A clean restart causes the CC to reset its networking configuration, regardless of whether or not it is in use. A clean restart of a CC managing active VMs can cause the network connectivity of those VMs to be irreparably lost.
